markdownRemark.html:
Score: 82.5

eonline.com  (WEB - en-US)

The online extension of E!, a 24-hour cable TV entertainment channel produced by E! Entertainment Television, which offers celebrity gossip and entertainment news.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The site is owned by NBCUniversal Inc., a subsidiary of Comcast Corp., one of the world’s largest telecommunications and media companies.

Content

Eonline.com publishes stories, photos, and video pieces about celebrities and entertainment news, as well as content from its scripted and reality television shows like “Keeping up with the Kardashians.”  The site is known for coverage of celebrity events and awards shows, with what-they-wore photo galleries and fashion reviews posting online in real time.

It has sections on red carpet events, original E! Shows, television, music and film news, and celebrity lifestyles, including couples, babies, homes, beauty and fitness.

A livestream of the cable TV channel is available from the site for subscribers.

Credibility

Text and video stories are produced by staff. Stories often report casting or celebrity news by quoting unnamed sources, or with citations like “E! News has learned ...’’ It has also relied on secondary sources, such as its NBC parent, along with sites like TMZ that often publish anonymously sourced reports without much elaboration.

Headlines speak in tabloid gossip style: “Katy Perry and Orlando Bloom Cozy Up for a Selfie at   Colosseum in Rome,” or “Chrissy Teigen and John Legend Celebrate at Baby Shower with Kim Kardashian and Kanye West.”

Transparency

The site does not provide information about who’s in charge, but executive biographies can be found on the NBCUniversal website. The site allows user comments at the end of each news story. The FAQ page offers an email feedback link, but does not make clear how errors might be corrected.  

Editors at Eonline.com and representatives of NBCUniversal, E's owner, did not respond to six emails from NewsGuard seeking information on how the site makes corrections, how to reach content creators, and its standards for using anonymous sources.

Authors’ names are listed on the site without background information. Advertisements appear separate from news content. The site offers a program that lets users control the ads they see.

Eonline.com is ad-supported, deploying video ads, display ads, and sponsored content.

History

The E! Network went on the air in 1987, when it was called Movietime, airing awards and entertainment news and film trailers. It changed its name to E! In 1990 and became known for shows including Talk Soup, and Fashion Police, with irreverent reviews anchored by comedian Joan Rivers, and reality series.

EOnline debuted as a site in the 1990s and was rebranded to its current format in 2012. Ryan Seacrest, former host of E! News, remains executive producer of the red-carpet programs.

Written by:
Stu Rohrer

Edited by:
Amy Westfeldt Eric Effron
